content.description: Great route that would have lines on it everyday if it weren't a pitch off the ground. It's in you right away with a goos sequence of jugs and crimps to a big rest jug. Recover here and get through the next half of the route which isn't as hard but will keep your attention. There is one committing move to the clipping jug at the anchors but the fall is fine.
content.protection: 9 bolts to an anchor with two lockers as lower offs
content.location: From the upper anchor at the top of This Toilet Earth, traverse straight left for a couple bolts then follow them up. Anchors of this thing are visible from the belay.

content.description: Same start as for Gold Digger but go up at the first bolt. This thing is delicate crimpy climbing the whole way up. There are two spots on it with big jugs to rest at but the rest is fairly sustained. Get ready to reach far on small holds. The bolts are far at times and there is one section where you could take a ride if you fell but its high enough up the route to be safe. Book calls this R but it seems 3 bolts were added after the book was published so I'll give it PG-13.
content.protection: 12 bolts to an anchor with rap rings.
content.location: From the anchor at the top of This Toilet Earth go straight left then up after the first bolt and follow the rest up.
